Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: MATERIAL AND METHOD : A 40 - year - old woman presented with decreased sensation and paresthesia over her right lateral forearm ; the paresthesia had occurred after a steroid injection in the right lateral epicondyle 3 months before .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| Decreased sensation |
| Paresthesia |

The paragraph describes a 40-year-old woman experiencing decreased sensation and paresthesia in her right lateral forearm. The onset of these symptoms occurred three months after a steroid injection in the right lateral epicondyle. Decreased sensation refers to a reduced ability to feel touch, pain, temperature, or other sensations. Paresthesia is an abnormal sensation, often described as tingling, prickling, or numbness.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Disease |
| --- |
| Decreased sensation |
| Paresthesia |

The paragraph describes the woman's experience of decreased sensation and paresthesia in her right lateral forearm. These symptoms occurred after a steroid injection in the right lateral epicondyle. Decreased sensation refers to a reduced ability to feel touch, pain, temperature, or other sensations. Paresthesia is an abnormal sensation, often described as tingling, prickling, or numbness. The steroid injection itself is not considered a disease in this context.
